fields.name: Load Outlier Heuristics
fields.description: Automatically generated widget from function LoadOutlierHeuristics in package crossbee. The original function signature: LoadOutlierHeuristics.

fields.name: Relative
fields.description: If false then absolute number of terms apearing in outlier documents is used. If true, the relative number of terms is used - based on the frequency of the term in the whole dataset.

fields.name: Outlier Heuristics Specification
fields.description: Automatically generated widget from function OutlierHeuristicsSpec in package crossbee. The original function signature: OutlierHeuristicsSpec.

fields.name: Document Outlier Detection
fields.description: Document outlier detection method is using missclassified document instances as otlier candidates.

fields.name: Dataset
fields.description: Latino.Model.LabeledDataset`2[[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089],[Latino.SparseVector`1[[System.Double, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]], Latino, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

fields.name: Corss-Validation Repetitions
fields.description: How many times the whole cross-validation procedure is repeated.

fields.name: Outlier Score Threshold
fields.description: Minimal number of times a single document needs to be that it is proclaimed outlier (usualy min=1 and max = 'Corss-Validation Repetitions').

fields.name: No weighting: output is list of indexes of outlier documents
Absolute: weight is absolute number of time a document was labeld outlier through all repetitions
Relative: weight is relative percentage how many times a document was labeled outlier through all repetitions
Standard Heuristic
fields.description: Automatically generated widget from function ConstructStandardHeurisitc in package crossbee. The original function signature: ConstructStandardHeurisitc.

fields.name: appearInAllDomn: better baseline heuristic which can separate two classes of terms - the ones that appear in both domains and the ones that appear only in one
freqTerm: term frequency across both domains
freqDoc: document frequency across both domains
freqRatio: term to document frequency ratio
freqDomnRatioMin: minimum of term frequencies ratio between both domains
freqDomnProd: product of term frequencies in both domains
freqDomnProdRel: product of term frequencies in both domains relative to the term frequency in all domains
tfidfSum: sum of all tf idf weights of a term across both domains
tfidfAvg: average tf idf of a term
tfidfDomnProd: product of a term’s importance in both domains
tfidfDomnSum: sum of a term’s importance in both domains
simAvgTerm: similarity to an average term – the distance from the center of the cluster of all terms
simDomnProd: product of a term’s similarity to the centroids of both domains
simDomnRatioMin: minimum of a term‘s frequencies ratio between both domains
